antenna noun
(NOTICING)
[ C usually plural ] plural antennae or antennas the natural ability to notice things and understand their importance: Her finely-tuned political antennae helped her to sense problems that less experienced politicians might not detect.

antenna noun [C]
(INSECT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
plural antennae us/ænˈten·i/ either of the two long, thin parts attached to the head of an insect that it uses to know what is around it: fig. Her political antennae helped her answer questions without offending anyone.
antenna noun [C]
(BROADCASTING)
plural antennas a structure made of metal rods or wires, often positioned on top of a building or vehicle, that receives or sends radio or television signals
